aboutpara:
Chun-Ju Tao is a Computer Engineering master’s student at NYU with a 3.78 GPA and a solid foundation in software development, DevOps, and AI applications. Proficient in Python, JavaScript, C#, Go, and PostgreSQL, he has successfully delivered impactful projects across diverse industries. 

Notable accomplishments include optimizing microservices with Docker and AWS ECS, creating a material management system for a government organization, and developing AI-driven solutions like an NLP-based news presenter. 

Chun-Ju has demonstrated leadership by implementing Agile practices, enhancing team efficiency during rapid growth, and winning multiple awards for technical innovation. His achievements reflect a commitment to driving operational excellence and delivering scalable, modern solutions.

resume.description: Computer Engineering master’s student at NYU with extensive experience in software development, DevOps, and AI applications. Proven success in optimizing processes, leading collaborative projects, and delivering innovative solutions across multiple industries.

bullets: Containerized 4 microservices of an LLM pipeline and developed a DevOps workflow using Docker, GitHub Actions, and AWS ECS, reducing operational costs by 40%.
Researched and implemented Agentic RAG with LlamaIndex, reducing token usage up to 5 times and enabling complex question-answering capabilities.
Developed a full-stack material management system for Taiwan Water Corporation, automating budgeting and inventory control for assets worth trillions.
Established GitFlow and Agile-like development model, improving team efficiency during a 300% team expansion.
Migrated a legacy system to .NET framework using C#, Microsoft SQL, and Vue.js, enhancing scalability and user experience.
